title: Essay Typography
content:
Hi,

Im new to this so please go easy. Im creating an essay for my final year project and im after a font for the main body of the essay which isnt the standard "arial" or "calibri" fonts, but I still want it to be easy to read.

Can anyone point me in the direction of a font which might be suitable, I dont mind paying for the font.

Regards,

James
author: Spadez

comments.content:
Essay about what?  
A safe choice, for printed text would be a serifed typeface.

Its a design related essay. I dont really want the font to reflect the content in this case, im just after a nice alternative to the standard essay fonts.

I understand I need a serif font, but there are so many :s

Even if you don't want the font to reflect the content, it should at least remain appropriate.  
Dp you need "special" features? (i.e. small caps, lining numerals, superscript, semibold, optical sizes for footnotes, etc.)
You mentioned default Microsoft fonts. Are you at a institution with a full Adobe install?

Hi. I don't need any special features, just numbers, lower and upper case.

I have access to all the adobe programs and I will probably be using in design for the project.

I'm not really after anything wacky, just something easy on the eyes :)

Adobe apps come bundled with a number of fine serif text typefaces.  
Adobe Caslon, for one, or, if you want something a bit less formal, Chaparral.
I set my dissertation in Arno Pro. It worked beautifully.
